item.title: Comment on USA fact of the day by Crusader
item.description:
I wonder if this is actually a result of a positive underlying change or more just that there’s X number of people in the US highly likely to die if a potent drug comes to the market (eg Fentanyl) and the majority of them have tragically already died. It’s not as if there’s a gargantuan stream of new addicts every year.

Comment URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/09/usa-fact-of-the-day-9.html?commentID=160813413

item.title: Comment on Wednesday assorted links by David Khoo
item.description:
5.

I'm not going to comment directly on the claims Oscar Health makes about OpenAI o1-preview. Instead, I think that Tyler should link to fewer article where any company is promoting their own product, or at least indicate when an article may be self-promotion (with more than a question mark at the end of the link).

It's nearly always a huge waste of time to read such material. I update my beliefs or knowledge almost none, because every incentive is for them to cherry pick, puff up or even lie (to themselves, at least). Yes, it's interesting and speculative and so forth, but I want to know which links I can just skip for the same reason why I run an ad-blocker.

Comment URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/09/wednesday-assorted-links-471.html?commentID=160813257

Post URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/09/wednesday-assorted-links-471.html?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=wednesday-assorted-links-471

item.title: Comment on Scholars in support of the Moraes Brazil decision against X by Restless carrot
item.description:
They don't understand that Moraes is violating the Brazilian constitution which forbids censorship. Musk is right in not following his orders since they are ilegal according to Brazilian law. Therefore, there was no possibility of violation of "digital" sovereignty involved in this case.
